comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Probably the daughter of Senator James A. O'Gorman of New York en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Aloysius_O%27Gorman From NYT Obituary, January 19, 1974 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FA0F17F63E5B1A74... "Mrs. Agnes O'Gorman Shanley, widow of J. Sanford Shanley, an architect who died in 1969, died Thursday ... She was 78 years old ..." That would make her 18 if this is a 1914 photo, which seems reasonable. If so, her marriage announcement was in NYT of May 28, 1922 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F40916F93E5E1A738... "Former Senator and Mrs. James A. O'Gorman have sent out invitations for the wedding of their daughter, Miss Agnes O'Gorman, and Joseph Sanford Shanley, son of Mrs. M.R. Seton Shanley of Newark, N.J.," In December 1914, she was "introduced" to society. "MISSES O'GORMAN ARE BUDS; Senator's Daughters Anna and Agnes Introduced at Home." select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F4091EFB3F5C1373...
